August 25, 1996: Fiction
SERVANT OF THE BONES, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $26.) A dark angel seeking
redemption makes a perilous journey from ancient Babylon to modern Manhattan.
THE RUNAWAY JURY, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $26.95.) A woman in a
Mississippi Gulf Coast town sues a tobacco company for causing her husband's
death.
THE LAST DON, by Mario Puzo. (Random House, $25.95.) The aging head of a
Mafia family makes plans for his heirs' activities in Hollywood and Las Vegas.
CAUSE OF DEATH, by Patricia Cornwell. (Putnam, $25.95.) Dr. Kay Scarpetta
investigates the mysterious death of a reporter and a murder that involves her own
niece.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
FALLING UP, by Shel Silverstein. (HarperCollins, $16.95.) Poems and drawings,
for children and grown-ups, celebrating strange characters and experiences.
THE TENTH INSIGHT, by James Redfield. (Warner, $19.95.) A journey through
the Appalachian Mountains provides answers to life's enigmas.
EXCLUSIVE, by Sandra Brown. (Warner, $22.95.) Should a television reporter
broadcast the secrets confided to her by the First Lady?
HOW STELLA GOT HER GROOVE BACK, by Terry McMillan. (Viking, $23.95.) A
divorced black woman finds romance on a Jamaican holiday.
THE WEDDING, by Julie Garwood. (Pocket, $23.) A 12th-century Scottish laird
captures and marries an English lady.
LILY WHITE, by Susan Isaacs. (HarperCollins, $25.) A defense lawyer takes on
the case of a con man charged with murder, whose true motives mystify her.
GODS AND GENERALS, by Jeff Shaara. (Ballantine, $25.) The progress of four
military leaders on their way to Gettysburg; a prequel to "The Killer Angels."
PASSAGE TO DAWN, by R. A. Salvatore. (TSR, $23.99.) A fiend from the Abyss
sets a deadly trap for the elf Drizzt; a fantasy tale.
CADILLAC JUKEBOX, by James Lee Burke. (Hyperion, $22.95.) The Louisiana
detective Dave Robicheaux becomes involved in a murder case that reflects the
tensions between the Old and New South.
PRIMARY COLORS, by Anonymous. (Random House, $24.) A certain Southern
governor and his wife on the road to the White House.
August 25, 1996
Non-Fiction
THE DILBERT PRINCIPLE, by Scott Adams. (Harper Business, $20.) A satirical
look, in words and cartoons, at the current foibles of business and management.
UNLIMITED ACCESS, by Gary Aldrich. (Regnery, $24.95.) Events in the Clinton
White House as reported by an F.B.I. agent formerly on duty there.
OUTRAGE, by Vincent Bugliosi. (Norton, $25.) The reasons, according to the
former Los Angeles County prosecutor, that O. J. Simpson was found not guilty.
BAD AS I WANNA BE, by Dennis Rodman with Tim Keown. (Delacorte, $22.95.)
The memoirs of the flamboyant basketball player.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
UNDAUNTED COURAGE, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
The story of how Thomas Jefferson sponsored Lewis and Clark's exploration of
the American West.
BARE KNUCKLES AND BACK ROOMS, by Ed Rollins with Tom DeFrank.
(Broadway Books, $27.50.) A political consultant recalls his 30 years behind the
scenes.
EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE, by Daniel Goleman. (Bantam, $23.95.) Factors
other than I.Q. that contribute to a successful and happy life.
DOMINIQUE MOCEANU: AN AMERICAN CHAMPION, by Dominique Moceanu
as told to Steve Woodward. (Bantam, $14.95.) The autobiography of the 14-year-
old Olympic gymnast.
THE AWAKENING HEART, by Betty J. Eadie. (Pocket, $20.) The survivor of a
near-death experience tells of the lessons it taught her about facing life's
problems.
THE CHOICE, by Bob Woodward. (Simon & Schuster, $26.) A behind-the-scenes
account of Bill Clinton's and Bob Dole's activities over the past two years.
IN CONTEMPT, by Christopher A. Darden with Jess Walter. (Regan Books/
HarperCollins, $26.) The trial of O. J. Simpson as seen by one of the prosecutors.
HOW COULD YOU DO THAT?! by Laura Schlessinger. (HarperCollins, $22.) Self-
indulgent morality, and ways to overcome it.
DRINKING: A LOVE STORY, by Caroline Knapp. (Dial, $22.95.) A journalist
recalls her 20-year addiction to alcohol.
JACK AND JACKIE, by Christopher Andersen. (Morrow, $24.) A portrait of the
